title: CBTF - Caught by the Fuzz!
text: simple mechanism fuzz-test exported functions R package. moment extremely limited: operates first argument doesnâ€™t introduce randomness. However, â€™s convenient large number functions test.

title: CBTF - Caught by the Fuzz!
code: library(CBTF) funs <- get_exported_functions("glue") what <- TRUE fuzz(funs, what) ##  ##  ðŸš¨   CAUGHT BY THE FUZZ!   ðŸš¨ ##  ## FAIL: glue_data ( logical ) ##     names(x) must be a character vector of the same length as x  ##  ## FAIL: glue_data_col ( logical ) ##     names(x) must be a character vector of the same length as x  ##  ## FAIL: glue_data_safe ( logical ) ##     names(x) must be a character vector of the same length as x  ##  ## FAIL: glue_data_sql ( logical ) ##     there is no package called 'DBI'  ##  ## FAIL: glue_sql ( logical ) ##     there is no package called 'DBI'  ##  ## FAIL: glue_sql_collapse ( logical ) ##     there is no package called 'DBI'

text: function calls functions receives object specified .

title: Fuzz-test the specified functions â€” fuzz
code: fuzz(funs, what, ignore.patterns = NULL, ignore.warnings = FALSE)

title: Fuzz-test the specified functions â€” fuzz
text: funs character vector function names test. "package" attribute set, functions loaded directly package namespace; otherwise, functions searched workspace. object passed first argument functions funs. ignore.patterns character string containing regular expression match messages ignore. ignore.warnings Whether warnings ignored (FALSE default).
